column2: PENNSYLVANIA DMV TEST
column6: PA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 2. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 3. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 4. Before backing up, you should:
column4: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column6: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 5. If the truck ahead swings right before making a left turn at an intersection, it is very dangerous to:
column4: sound your horn at the truck driver.
column6: yield the right-of-way to the truck driver.
column8: stop behind the truck until it has completed the turn.
column10: try to squeeze between the truck and curb to make a left turn.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Wrong Way

column2: 7. The yield sign means:
column4: Go. The light will soon be red.
column6: Stop if you can.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 8. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column6: blue; white

column2: 9. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column6: no passing zone

column2: 10. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 11. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 12. When drivers see this road sign:
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 13. To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, start your turn from:
column4: the lane in the center of the road.
column6: the lane closest to the right curb.
column8: any lane, as long as it is safe.
column10: the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 14. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: at roundabouts.

column2: 15. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: can not turn left.
column8: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 16. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 17. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column6: you see in your side mirror.
column8: you see in your rearview mirror.
column10: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 18. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
